hey i am wondering can anyone help me with a problem,

i wanted to add some tracks to the games music but i seem to be having trouble, when i go into the Options men>audio setup>user track options,

it says to create shortcuts in the "user tracks folder", i dont see that folder anywhere

"""tm910 at 2011-06-16 20:08 CET:
hey i am wondering can anyone help me with a problem,

i wanted to add some tracks to the games music but i seem to be having trouble, when i go into the Options men>audio setup>user track options,

it says to create shortcuts in the "user tracks folder", i dont see that folder anywhere"""

Go to your Documents.  There will be a folder called "GTA San Andreas User Files" then go to "User Tracks" and then copy music over to that location.  Once you moved the files over you have to detect them while in the game under advanced audio options i think.  Just explore in the in-game audio options and you will come across it.

My recommendation: do NOT download.

 While the game downloads fast and works like a charm, with no need for any installment operations, it is filled with some mods that look like created by some socially awkward tweens. And the problem is, I'm not around that age anymore. (awh the good ol' days, how i miss them! *swallowing thick nostalgic bitterness*)

 I do recommend it though if there is nothing else that works, but otherwise the really juvenile mods just ruin the overall gameplay. 

(It even contains an unremoveable, cartoony chopper bike with a giant skull on it, that fills the entire countryside.)

I havnt bothered yet to check if it has got multiplayer. But choose as you wish!
